name: Gityup-lua
tagline: given a directory full of Git working directories, iterate through them and pull updates
body:
Git Multi-Pull
==============

My standard scenario for learning new languages is to write a tool that
loops through child directories of a given directory and tries to pull
updates from remote repositories.

Examples
--------

I did this a few years ago with [Haskell](http://www.haskell.org/), although I was using [Subversion](http://subversion.apache.org/)
at the time.

[svnup-haskell](https://kevwil.github.io/svnup-haskell)

I've done it with [Windows Powershell](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=89597) and [Bash](http://www.gnu.org/software/bash/) shell scripting too, but those aren't published.

Dependencies
------------

At the time of this writing, I am using [Lua](http://www.lua.org/) 5.2.4. I have not tested past or future versions,
but I would expect them to work.

Because Lua doesn't have a built-in way to iterate through directories, I used the
[LuaRocks](http://luarocks.org/) module "LuaFileSystem". You'll need to have that module
installed for this to work.

License
-------

Standard BSD.
